Description: Bowl (sherd.rim). Made of turquoise glazed pottery (buff).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, The MLA register book states that this fragment came, together with many others accessioned on the same date, "from Fostat and the rubbish mounds outside the Bab en Nasr, Cairo". However, very similar pottery is known from the Kharga Oasis, which was being excavated in the 1890s.
Curator's comments: Very similar pottery fragments from the Kharga Oasis are in New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Rogers Fund 1925, accession no. 25.10.20.23a-rr.
